citation.article-title: Terrabacter lapilli sp. nov., an actinomycete isolated from stone.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Terrabacter lapilli sp. nov.
Terrabacter lapilli (la.pil′li. L. gen. n. lapilli of a small stone).
Cells are Gram-positive, aerobic, oxidase-negative, catalase-positive, non-motile, short rods (0.3–0.5×1.0–1.4 μm).
Colonies are circular, smooth, convex with entire margins and bright yellow.
Grows at 10–40 °C and pH 4.1–12.1, but does not grow at 4 or 42 °C.
Growth occurs in the presence of up to 3.0 % (w/v) NaCl, but not with 4.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Positive for nitrate reduction and gelatin hydrolysis.
Assimilates d-glucose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, maltose and gluconate, but not d-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol or malate.
Positive for leucine arylamidase and α-glucosidase.
Other physiological and biochemical characteristics are given in Table 1.
ll-DAP is the diagnostic diamino acid in the cell wall.
Whole-cell sugars are glucose, rhamnose, ribose, xylose and arabinose.
The polar lipids contain diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and unknown phospholipids.
The major cellular fatty acid is iso-C15 : 0 (43.0 %).
The DNA G+C content is 72.6 mol%.
The type strain, LR-26T (=JBRI 2002T =KCTC 19199T =DSM 18583T), was isolated from a small stone collected from an agricultural field in Jeju, Republic of Korea.
